programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian begins the next leg of his trip in Kasama, northern Zambia. His first stop is the town of Mpika, where he meets college students training to be locomotive drivers. Next, in the capital Lusaka, he reveals how the first railways were built to access the country's rich mineral wealth, and watches craftsmen cutting emeralds and rubies - before being let loose on a pair of bejewelled cufflinks. Griff then reaches the spectacular Victoria Falls on his way to Zimbabwe's second-largest city, Bulawayo.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson takes a four-day trek along the coastline between Plymouth in Devon and Falmouth, learning about the thriving smuggling trade in Cornwall during the late 18th century. The area's tiny secretive harbours, beaches and secluded coves were ideal for illicit imports such as tobacco and brandy, and the business was so huge it threatened the national economy. Along his route, visiting such beauty spots as Lantic Bay and Polperro, he encounters all sorts of reminders of the trade and meets descendants of those involved.

programme.title: Forbidden History

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.sub-title: To the Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Arctic and Antarctic to explore the wildernesses at Earth's poles, investigating the wildlife and geographical features found there. He begins by travelling to the North Pole, where two polar bears reveal a surprisingly tender side to their characters, before heading to the South Pole - 100 years after Roald Amundsen and Robert Falcon Scott first reached it.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Documentary examining the plants and animals that thrive in monsoon areas, narrated by Colin Salmon. Crested black macaques take advantage of an abundance of fruit, and maleo birds use the sun to incubate their eggs on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. On Java, locals climb volcanoes to offer live sacrifices in thanks for the peaks' help in precipitating rain and fertilising plants with ash. The frequent and heavy rains in Borneo have destroyed the soils, created fierce competition for scarce nutrients, and driven evolution to produce some curious creatures. The Rajah Brooke's pitcher encourages tree shrews to relieve themselves to obtain the substances it needs, while the Bornean red leech is capable of swallowing the giant blue earthworm in one gulp.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Exploring the relationship that has developed over thousands of years between the people who live in monsoon regions and the wildlife they share them with. In the rice paddies of Assam, India, farmers battle a herd of hungry elephants over their crops, while on the Philippine island of Palawan, near Borneo, people still hunt in the forest and live in caves for part of the year. The programme also looks at the impact of organised religion, meeting members of the Bishnoi sect who believe that all life is sacred and have even been known to lay down their lives to protect trees. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: Attenborough's Living Lights
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of bioluminescence, the often spectacular natural light produced by creatures including glow-worms, fireflies and plankton, using specially designed cameras, some fitted to a new generation of deep-sea submersibles and robots to record instances in the very deep ocean. The programme shows a millipede glowing on the forest floor in California, the mesmerising flashing light patterns of the synchronous firefly, the spooky glow of a rare dragon fish and luminous earth worms in France.

Charlie MacFell returns from university to the family farm, where his strict father still rules with an iron fist - a situation that soon changes thanks to a misunderstanding with a foolish farmhand. Lloyd Owen stars, with Catherine Zeta-Jones, Tom Bell and Maria Mile.

programme.desc: The nuns and midwives are busy preparing for Sister Evangelina's surprise jubilee celebrations, marking 50 years since she took her vows, but a face from the past threatens to ruin the party for the guest of honour. It's back to business when a young woman with Down's syndrome is brought in feeling unwell. To everyone's surprise, they discover she is six months pregnant, causing some of them to think the worst, and the staff are joined by new nurse Patsy, whose sense of humour and no-nonsense attitude make her an instant hit.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie is chuffed when local curate Tom invites her to join him for a day of cricket, sending her to work with a spring in her step. Is love on the cards for the young midwife? Shelagh's infertility has made her think long and hard about what she wants in life, so she approaches her husband with an idea, while Patsy upsets a young mother in the clinic and is moved to the district rota, where she works tirelessly to diagnose a docker's unusual symptoms.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Silent Witness

An argument quickly ensues between the police and the US embassy, which claims the murder falls under its jurisdiction, while the Lyell crew fights against the bureaucracy of the FBI, aided only by the US deputy chief of mission Matt Garcia. However, when he goes missing, Nikki is concerned he might be the next target.

Drama, starring Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston, with Jack Shepherd (Wycliffe, Into the Storm), John McArdle (Brookside) and Anna Chancellor (Four Weddings and a Funeral, Spooks).

Jess tells Sean she is not ready to break the news about the baby to her father - but that's the least of her worries after she goes for a scan.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Charlie's colleagues demonstrate their support for him in the sexual harassment case being brought by Mrs O'Donnell, while a local journalist claims to have injured his wrist in a bid to get to the heart of the story.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The hunt for Abi Nixon's kidnapper takes on renewed urgency when it appears she is being held captive in a sealed container with only a couple of hours' oxygen left. Psychological profiler Dr Hugh Wallis reckons the taunting messages sent by the culprit point to an old adversary with a grudge, and soon pinpoints a likely suspect, while Phil offers the distraught Sam solace in her darkest hour.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Celestine tries to reassure Etta about Lloyd, and Sharon is upset about Grant making plans for the future without consulting her.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ethel is forced to make a difficult decision, one that has serious consequences for a very close friend.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A new station commander arrives and causes friction in the team as he implements a stricter regime. Meanwhile, a fire is started at a local primary school.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: Who Is the Fairest of Them All?
programme.desc: The antiques dealer is asked to sell a sinister-looking mirror from a ballet school, and determines to finally marry Lady Jane. However, the object of his affections has some shocking news for him that suggests he may have left matters too late. Roger Lloyd Pack (Trigger in Only Fools and Horses) guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Ice maiden Philippa Vale shows up in Jersey just as a large diamond is about to be auctioned - and sure enough, it soon disappears. Liza Goddard guests alongside John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Freddie's sea-faring brother dies, so the Boswells decide it would be fitting to arrange a burial at sea. Carla Lane's comedy, starring Jean Boht and Ronald Forfar.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The store advertises on Citizen Band radio, but unfortunately Mrs Slocombe's attempt to publicise her underwear attracts the attentions of the wrong type of customer. Shop-floor comedy, with Mollie Sugden and featuring the voice of Robbie Coltrane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean opens another secretarial agency, but needs someone to run it. Work for Lionel seems to have dried up, giving her cause for concern. Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg comes off his bike after cycling downhill and sustains a fractured foot. Truly believes that the accident would never have happened if the vehicle had been fitted with studded tyres - and immediately sets about organising a practical demonstration of his theory.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The maverick High Court Judge's daughter is arrested during a demonstration, presenting him with the challenge of getting her off the hook without falling foul of powerful enemies he has made in his single-minded push to the top of the legal profession. Martin Shaw, Donald Sinden and Caroline Langrishe star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: UCOS looks into the murder of a private investigator who was stabbed through the heart in a suspected robbery gone wrong. The answers may lie with the victim's last three cases, but it'll take the whole team's expertise to crack the codes within his mysterious notebook. The movements of a rare stamp could hold the key to the investigation - if only UCOS could track it down. Meanwhile, Steve has problems when he rents out his flat.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Jardine and Taggart investigate the murder of a pensioner, focusing their inquiries on his daughter and son-in-law. Unfortunately, the case soon takes an unexpected turn. Glasgow-set detective drama, starring Mark McManus and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: The Lost World
programme.desc: Trapped on the plateau, Edward, Agnes and Lord Roxton set out in search of professors Challenger and Summerlee, following their capture by the strange apemen who may provide the missing link between modern man and prehistoric life. But when they mount a rescue, the explorers are confronted by a native tribe. Conclusion of the adventure, starring Bob Hoskins, Peter Falk and James Fox.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Period medical drama chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Mark and Cate's new baby falls ill, which prompts a revelation from Cate. Meanwhile, Butcher and Stacey grow closer when he rescues a soldier.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The hunt for Abi Nixon's kidnapper takes on renewed urgency when it appears she is being held captive in a sealed container with only a couple of hours' oxygen left. Psychological profiler Dr Hugh Wallis reckons the taunting messages sent by the culprit point to an old adversary with a grudge, and soon pinpoints a likely suspect, while Phil offers the distraught Sam solace in her darkest hour.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Rosie suffers complications with her pregnancy and has to undergo an emergency Caesarean, but the outcome has heartbreaking repercussions for all concerned. Jess tries to get out of her quandary by telling Sean she is going to have an abortion, though he begs her not to go through with it. Connie suspends Will after he unwittingly talks to a journalist about the canteen strike he caused.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A man fractures his right leg in two places and cracks a rib after the walls of a well fall onto him. Tragedy strikes after Josh is asked to attend a fire at his own home, while Matt hands in his resignation and makes plans to move to Crete.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Samantha is appalled when it becomes clear that psychological profiler Dr Hugh Wallis has brainwashed Abi, who not only refuses to name him as her kidnapper but agrees to return home with him. The situation becomes even more dire when Peter Baxter is charged with the abduction, leaving Samantha wondering how she can convince her colleagues of the terrible truth. Meanwhile, sexy new recruit PC Amber Johannsen turns heads at Sun Hill, although Gina is unimpressed by her slipshod approach to police work, and Ramani crosses swords with an abusive wife and mother.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian entertains an important business client, while Pat sets Frank a daunting task.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Dot fears the launderette has been broken into, Ian is looking troubled, Clyde and Hattie are sure that Lloyd is up to no good, while Frank makes Dot an offer she cannot refuse.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A dramatic warehouse fire in London requires every fire squad in the area to deal, leaving the rest of the city vulnerable to unfortunate mishaps. The Blue Watch team is called in to deal with such an emergency when a nuclear fuel train comes to a stop, and Tate makes a frightening discovery.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Left to look after Felsham Hall until it has been sold, Lovejoy uses the house as a furniture showroom. It seems unlikely anyone could replace Lady Jane in the dodgy dealer's affections - but that doesn't prevent his eye being caught by glamorous auctioneer Charlotte Cavendish. Charlie Gimbert eventually buys the property, and agrees to rent the stables for Lovejoy Antiques. Patricia Hayes guest stars in an episode directed by Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A pair of rich fashion designers are too preoccupied to realise their child's nanny is not all she seems. When their worst nightmare comes true and their baby is abducted, it is up to Jim to track them down. John Nettles stars, with Sheila Ruskin and Duncan Preston.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Aveline bares all for the front cover of a magazine, Adrian finds himself out of a job and a card game leaves Freddie 500 in debt.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The gang visits 10 Downing Street to campaign against a Japanese takeover - and Mrs Slocombe gets a chance to demonstrate that Britain has women even more formidable than Mrs Thatcher. Comedy, starring Mollie Sugden and John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean searches for a manager to run the agency, while Lionel gets to work on the outline for an American mini-series based on their real-life romance. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Smiler reminisces about a woman who escaped his advances during the war without leaving her contact details, so Truly, Alvin and Billy volunteer to track her down - even though it means a foray into hostile territory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Brian Murphy, Keith Clifford and Stephen Lewis.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: A concerned mother hires Hetty to find out who is stalking her daughter just days before her wedding. It's not long before the unlikely sleuth is on the trail of a disgraced soldier with a grudge against the father of the bride-to-be. Light-hearted drama, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Spin-off from Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries, set in the 1960s, following Miss Fisher's niece, who sets out to investigate what happened to her aunt. In the first of a two-part story, Peregrine Fisher arrives in Melbourne to collect her inheritance from her aunt, Phryne Fisher. Wanting to be part of the same Adventuresses' Club as her aunt, Peregrine decides to follow in Phryne's footsteps and solve the murder of a dead model at a bridal fashion show. Geraldine Hakewill stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A skeleton uncovered in the foundations of a swimming pool is identified as a young lottery winner named Cheryl, who was reported missing 17 years ago. The prime suspects are her fellow quiz team-mates, who won their lucky windfall as part of a syndicate, and while some have put their money to good use, the victim's boyfriend has fallen on hard times and the media remain convinced he is the key to her murder. As allegations of affairs, fights and betrayal begin to surface, the team is left to ponder whether money really is the root of all evil.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A body is discovered in the boot of a vehicle that has just been through the car crusher, presenting Taggart and Jardine with a case that seems to connect the worlds of drug dealers and artists. Mark McManus and James Macpherson star.

programme.title: Lorna Doone
programme.desc: Lavish adaptation of RD Blackmore's novel of lovers, outlaws and warring families in 17th-century Exmoor. Amelia Warner stars as the eponymous heroine, with Queer as Folk's Aidan Gillen as her evil aristocratic cousin, who wants her for himself at any cost. The cast also includes Richard Coyle, Martin Clunes, Barbara Flynn and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The successful spring collection brings a surprise proposal for the future that threatens the sisters' partnership.

programme.desc: A Southampton couple invest 175,000 to modernise their home, while an Australian author plans an enviable loft conversion for her Dartmouth riverfront home. Interior design expert Linda Barker monitors their progress and helps appraise the end results.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: TV presenter Stephen Mulhern, X Factor judge Louis Walsh and pop star Rochelle Humes form the panel this week, as Keith Lemon ventures into three more mystery celebrities homes. The host records himself touring the residences, pointing out tell-tale clues that might hint at the owners' identities, before asking his studio panellists to guess 'who habitates in a house like this'.

programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the dealers turn up in Middlesbrough, where items include an oboe and a haul of gold jewellery.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A family from Andover answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Warul, Lyndsey, Valerie and Jonny pit their wits against quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but if anyone is caught they're out for good, leaving fewer players for the final chase.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jai fights temptation, Rhona makes a discovery and Jamie confronts the truth.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jai begins to unravel, Kim and Jamie unite and Rhona confronts Marlon.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: High Streets: End of the Road? Tonight
programme.desc: A report on the downward trend in spending in Britain's high-street stores over the past 10 years. Geraint Vincent follows typical shopping street Dalton Road in Barrow-in-Furness through the crucial festive period and hears from firms facing high rates and tough competition from the internet and retail parks. But to some, high streets are more than just a place of business - they are a crucial part of the community. Geraint also meets those trying to attract more visitors, and explores whether everyone has a responsibility to support town centres.

programme.title: Welcome to HMP Belmarsh with Ross Kemp
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ross Kemp's report from inside the maximum-security jail takes him to Belmarsh's jail-within-a-jail, where anti-Islamic inmates have to be separated from Islamic prisoners for fear of violence. He also heads to the prison healthcare unit, and meets transgender prisoner Claire Darbyshire, who was given one of the lowest minimum terms for murder in British legal history after killing her father.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: For the final leg of his journey, Gino D'Acampo takes a railway adventure to picturesque Lake Iseo, a hidden gem often overshadowed by its big sisters Garda and Como. He starts out angling for sardines, then takes his catch and prepares a dish of grilled fish for the passengers of Treno dei Sapore - a tourist train that takes guests along the lakeside and into the Franciacorta region. While they enjoy the views they also get a seven-course meal - with today's starter cooked by Gino.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When a student from a prestigious all-female college is found dead, Will and Geordie infiltrate the murky world of campus politics and university societies to find the killer. Navigating strange initiations, raucous parties - and with investigative journalist, Ellie Harding, hot on their heels - they need to use every advantage at their disposal to unravel the mystery. Cathy's ambitions for a life of her own start to test the delicate family balance, while fresh from a spell with Daniel in Marrakech, Leonard finds it hard to acclimatise to life back in Grantchester. Robson Green and Tom Brittney star.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Brian McFadden is at the home of pop star and actor Adam Rickitt as he plays host to four strangers in his home. Will Adam avoid the washing up with his cryptic clues as to his identity or will the four diners bag the cash prize and hand the rubber gloves to him?.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: High Streets: End of the Road? Tonight
programme.desc: A report on the downward trend in spending in Britain's high-street stores over the past 10 years. Geraint Vincent follows typical shopping street Dalton Road in Barrow-in-Furness through the crucial festive period and hears from firms facing high rates and tough competition from the internet and retail parks. But to some, high streets are more than just a place of business - they are a crucial part of the community. Geraint also meets those trying to attract more visitors, and explores whether everyone has a responsibility to support town centres.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson helps members of the public in Solihull sort the treasures from their trash. Simon Schneider gets into a movie poster shoot-out, while Fay Rutter eyes up a gent's Rolex. Henry Nicholls spends cash to not own some saucy postcards, while the auction leads to an emotional conclusion.

Rachel, James, Rebecca and Reno work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Rhona shocks Vanessa, Kim learns some troubling news and Jai has a plan.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: David's thrilled when Shona regains consciousness and tries to speak, until it becomes clear she doesn't recognise him. Paul's horrified when Sean reveals Bernie's plan, and Geoff suggests Yasmeen should steer clear of Speed Daal for a while as she might be tempted to have a drink.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia visits the lush Ionian island of Corfu, beginning in its capital, Corfu Town, where she discovers a surprising, cosmopolitan city more like a little slice of Italy than Greece. After sampling the delights of its famous mumquat flavoured ice-cream, a cookery lesson in making signature savoury dish pastitsada reveals the island's centuries-old love affair with exotic spices. Julia meets a pair of brothers passionate about revolutionising production of Corfu's oldest and most important export - olive oil- and ends her stay trying out the secret to staying young that all Corfiots swear by.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Realising he's been set up by Bernie, Kel makes a grab for her phone. Jade confronts Fiz in the street, and tells her she never intended for her to lose her kids, but she's only got herself to blame. Over their game of chess, Roy puts pressure on Nina to move in.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: After Will and Leonard witness a deadly and deliberate hit-and-run, Geordie traces the car to a pair of decidedly dysfunctional brothers, whose house lies far off the beaten path. The victim's wife, his employee and the two brothers are all damaged characters caught in a web of lies and betrayals - and it's not just secrets hiding within the siblings' grounds. Back at home, Will and Geordie both struggle as unwelcome guests look set to stay - Will's mum Amelia seems to have found a carbon copy of his late father in her new beau. Meanwhile, a new television set lands in the vicarage - just in time for Eurovision. Robson Green, Tom Brittney and Al Weaver star.

programme.title: The Brits Are Coming
programme.desc: Alice Levine announces the 2020 Brit Award nominees. With performances by some of 2019's biggest acts, including Liam Payne, Mabel, Aitch, Freya Ridings and Dermot Kennedy.

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: Adam finds himself in hot water at work, while his relationship with Karen continues to affect the group. Jenny has finished her cancer treatment, but her struggle is far from over, while David begins to see Mary in a new light. The return of Mike Bullen's comedy drama, starring James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five team of family members answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. An updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, this time featuring computer-animated characters on live-action modeled sets. With the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak and Thomas Brodie-Sangster, with the original Parker - David Graham - returning to voice Lady Penelope's long-serving chauffeur.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's challenge will see him attempt to escape from a helicopter simulator underwater. Has he got what it takes to be submerged?.

programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.desc: Tom and Jerry go on a wild car trip, when the butler instructs Tom to learn to drive.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: A bear has escaped from the zoo and Fizz is hell-bent on making it his pet. Magoo mistakes the bear for his niece who's come to spend the day with him..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket is selling up and moving on... but what will happen to Mr. Bean?.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: It's the biggest sporting event in Grimsby - the bog roll roll. All Dave has to do is chase the bog roll down the hill and catch it..

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. An updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, this time featuring computer-animated characters on live-action modeled sets. With the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak and Thomas Brodie-Sangster, with the original Parker - David Graham - returning to voice Lady Penelope's long-serving chauffeur.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by singer Louise Redknapp and chefs Jonathan Phang and Graham Garrett. Wine expert Ewen Lacey answers viewers' questions.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Vegetarian food ideas, presented by Henry Firth and Ian Theasby. First on the menu are Sunday roast, vegan cheese in a toasted sandwich, sticky toffee pudding and snack ideas using avocados. The hosts are joined by actress Sadie Frost, who tries their jalfrezi curry.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby host the celebrity skating challenge, joined by judges Christopher Dean, Jayne Torvill, Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman. Another six famous faces make their debut on the ice in the hope of avoiding the skate-off at the end of the show against last week's lowest-scoring performer. There is also a routine by the cast of new musical The Prince of Egypt. The full line-up of celebrities are Ben Hanlin, Caprice, Joe Swash, Ian 'H' Watkins, Kevin Kilbane, Libby Clegg, Lisa George, Lucrezia Millarini, Maura Higgins, Perri Kiely, Trisha Goddard and Radzi Chinyanganya.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle looks for blue sharks off the Isles of Scilly and Cornwall, while Liz Bonnin is in Dorset to sample local gin and find out why it is a true taste of the countryside. Plus, there's a return to Ravenseat Farm in the Yorkshire Dales, where shepherdess Amanda Owen and her brood of nine children head off to auction to sell their lambs.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on a large arcade-style 'coin-pusher' machine. The more counters they collect, the greater the prize fund, with the last one standing competing for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Quiz show hosted by Bradley Walsh. Pete, Sheila, Maisie and Noel must pit their wits against the Chaser, a ruthless quiz genius determined to stop them winning the cash prize..

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking contestants Sophie Ellis-Bextor, Sean Fletcher and Ryan Thomas to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the singing contest in which a celebrity panel and a studio audience must guess the famous faces performing behind elaborate costumes. Regular panellists Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Ken Jeong try to identify the mysterious celebrities disguised as a daisy, a fox, an octopus, a tree and a monster.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the latest round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through 'blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone. Meghan Trainor is the newest recruit to the judging panel, joining series regulars Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Will.i.am.

programme.title: Shopping with Keith Lemon
programme.desc: Keith takes Amanda Holden on a booze cruise to Calais and goes guitar shopping with rock band Busted, chatting about their lives and careers along the way.

programme.title: Horrible Bosses (2011)
programme.desc: A power-crazed bully, a sleazy cocaine addict and a sexual predator each make an employee's life a misery, but the three workers cannot afford to quit their jobs. They resort to desperate measures by conspiring to murder each other's bosses, with a little help from an eccentric ex-convict. Comedy, starring Jason Bateman, Charlie Day, Jason Sudeikis, Kevin Spacey, Jennifer Aniston and Colin Farrell.

programme.title: Teach My Pet to Do That
programme.desc: Animal lover, comedian and presenter Alexander Armstrong opens the doors of his multispecies pet training school, greeting Kevin the chow chow dog and Rambo the miniature New Zealand kunekune pig, to see if they can be taught to beg, spin and roll over. This week's star pet is Pudsey, the first dog to win Britain's Got Talent and which died recently. Plus, the show's trainers hit the road to see if they can train two chickens to play the world's most unusual game of Celebrity Guess Who by attempting to pick out the faces of Ant McPartlin and Katie Price from a constellation of stars.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. An updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, this time featuring computer-animated characters on live-action modeled sets. With the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak and Thomas Brodie-Sangster, with the original Parker - David Graham - returning to voice Lady Penelope's long-serving chauffeur.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's in Blackpool but is he brave enough to walk to the top of the UK's tallest rollercoaster?.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: A magician leaves behind his hat, and it creates magical mayhem for Tom, Jerry, and Spike.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo mistakes Fizz for his best friend Harry from school, and thinks the two of them are visiting their old school..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean takes on the Bruisers at the local skateboard park, using only a mobility scooter..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The Spuds don't care about a carbon footprint, since George has come home with a haul of free electronics that they all want to test out..

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Paws of Destiny
programme.desc: Mei Mei recruits Po and the students to perform in her new show, but things don't go to plan..

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott continues his tour of Jamaica, taking a trip into the Blue Mountains to learn the secrets of the region's famous coffee. He also visits one of the island's most acclaimed jerk chicken establishments and tries to get his hands on their secret recipe, before whipping up a mango and pineapple milkshake at famous hotel Jamaica Inn.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up a plant-based lasagne, a vegan breakfast - including smoky barbecue beans, vegan scrambled eggs and a meat-free alternative to bacon - and salted caramel apple crumble with custard. The duo also try to convince meat-loving weatherman Alex Beresford that their big bosh burger is as good as the meaty ones he loves, and for their snack hacks, they show off their recipes for nut butters.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: For the final leg of his journey, Gino D'Acampo takes a railway adventure to picturesque Lake Iseo, a hidden gem often overshadowed by its big sisters Garda and Como. He starts out angling for sardines, then takes his catch and prepares a dish of grilled fish for the passengers of Treno dei Sapore - a tourist train that takes guests along the lakeside and into the Franciacorta region. While they enjoy the views they also get a seven-course meal - with today's starter cooked by Gino.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia visits the lush Ionian island of Corfu, beginning in its capital, Corfu Town, where she discovers a surprising, cosmopolitan city more like a little slice of Italy than Greece. After sampling the delights of its famous mumquat flavoured ice-cream, a cookery lesson in making signature savoury dish pastitsada reveals the island's centuries-old love affair with exotic spices. Julia meets a pair of brothers passionate about revolutionising production of Corfu's oldest and most important export - olive oil- and ends her stay trying out the secret to staying young that all Corfiots swear by.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the latest round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through 'blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone. Meghan Trainor is the newest recruit to the judging panel, joining series regulars Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Will.i.am.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the singing contest in which a celebrity panel and a studio audience must guess the famous faces performing behind elaborate costumes. Regular panellists Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Ken Jeong try to identify the mysterious celebrities disguised as a daisy, a fox, an octopus, a tree and a monster.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Russell Kane, Leonie Elliott, Kevin Clifton and Bonnie Langford pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Following Trisha Goddard's elimination last week, the remaining 11 celebrities and their professional partners perform routines from famous musicals. They will be hoping to get a high score from judges Jayne Torvill, Christopher Dean, Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman - not to mention plenty of viewer votes - and avoid having to compete in the skate-off. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The body of 19-year-old apprentice electrician Dennis Bayliss is discovered washed up on the shore of a North Northumberland rural estate. The victim turns out to be the estranged son of Steph and Rob Bayliss who are left crippled by his death, having lost him once already when he abandoned them to seek out his biological father, Thomas Walken, who just happens to run a salmon farm on the spot where the body was found. Vera is forced to look closer at the strained relationships of Dennis's two families in order to find the truth about his death.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: For the next leg of their journey, the actor and his son head to the Great Smoky Mountains on the Tennessee-North Carolina border, where they go canoeing on the iconic rapids that featured in the film Deliverance. With Bradley left in need of a whisky, they head to a Hillbilly Jam for a nightcap and to experience the mountain tradition of clog dancing, before the pair try their hand at chopping wood with some competitive lumberjacks and taking to the woods to search for a mythical mountain beast.

programme.title: The Metro: A Rail Life Story
programme.desc: Documentary following workers on the Tyne and Wear Metro - the UK's largest metro system outside of London. In the first edition, staff in Sunderland prepare for the arrival of 50,000 Spice Girls fans ahead of the pop group's concert at the Stadium of Light. The pressure rises across the day as head of operations Wayne spots a potential fault with an overhead line, and there's an anxious call to the control room - a set of fans have lost their tickets for the concert of a lifetime. Narrated by Zoe Hakin.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Laura's online attack on Andrew yields unexpected consequences as a figure from her past returns to haunt her, potentially jeopardising the case. Laura resorts to extreme measures to find hard evidence of Andrew's guilt.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: I'd Do Anything and West End star Jodie Prenger does the honours in the kitchen as Team Glam sets out to guess the identity of their next celebrity host.

John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst star in Mike Bullen's long-running comedy drama, with guest appearances by Gemma Jones, Clare Keelan and Sunetra Sarker.

programme.title: Welcome to HMP Belmarsh with Ross Kemp
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ross Kemp's report from inside the maximum-security jail takes him to Belmarsh's jail-within-a-jail, where anti-Islamic inmates have to be separated from Islamic prisoners for fear of violence. He also heads to the prison healthcare unit, and meets transgender prisoner Claire Darbyshire, who was given one of the lowest minimum terms for murder in British legal history after killing her father.

He rounds off his trip by cooking at an award-winning vineyard.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: For the next leg of their journey, Bradley and Barney visit the Red River Gorge in Kentucky, before heading to the supposedly haunted Poasttown Elementary School in Middletown, Ohio. The next day, they travel to Louisville, birthplace of legendary boxer Muhammad Ali, where they follow in his footsteps by sparring at the local boxing gym. At the end of a long day, Barney rewards his dad with a well-earned meal at a KFC restaurant in Kentucky - the home state of the chain's founder Colonel Harland Sanders.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz shows the police the passports and ferry tickets, convinced Jade has abducted Hope. Carla tells an appalled Bethany how Ray made Michelle sign a gagging order, and Charlie returns to No 4 with her bags and explains she's been evicted.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: After a vital discovery at the farm, Stan and Mick feel closer to shoring up their own suspicions about Jeremy. The arrival of Brett, a friend from New Zealand (played by Game of Thrones star Alfie Allen), increases tensions between Jeremy and Julie, while Ann grows ever more alarmed and suspicious of her cousin Jeremy's behaviour, and his handling of the family estate. As preparations for the inquest continue, Stan is concerned that if the bodies are released for cremation, vital evidence will be lost for ever.
